tool_description: Find the best sell put option trade based on select criteria
name: Option Trade finder
title: Option Trade finder

api_list.name: findPutTrade
api_list.description: find a Put trade that meet criteria based on parameters

optional_parameters.name: strategy
optional_parameters.description:
Default value: *either*
This parameter selects options which have an underlying symbol trending up or trending down. Selling a put when a stock is up is safer, and premiums are lower. Selling a put option when a stock is down is riskier, and premiums are higher

optional_parameters.name: symbolList
optional_parameters.description: List of symbols to include. If empty, suggestions will include list of stock currently monitored by the system

optional_parameters.name: premium
optional_parameters.description:
select how to suggest premium limit value.
at-bid: returns last known bid value. trade will likely execute very fast
near-bid: returns value one increment above bid
at-lowmid: returns mid or closest lower increment
at-highmid: returns mid of closest higher increment
near-ask: returns one increment lower than last known ask
at-ask: returns last known ask

optional_parameters.name: excludeEvents
optional_parameters.description: Not supported in **v1**. Do not include in request or select *None*

optional_parameters.name: risk
optional_parameters.description:
Default: neutral



The *very conservative* and *conservative* options return a far in the money strike suggestion. *Neutral* and *agressive* options return strike price closer to underlying price. *Very aggressive* returns same strike as *agressive* and suggests trades with more than 1 contract for higher premiums and higher risks as diversification is limited
